git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/88/205588/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import base64 import logging import os import tarfile import tempfile from ironic_python_agent.inspector import base LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def collect(args): files = {args.log_file} | set(args.system_log_file or ()) with tempfile.TemporaryFile() as fp: with tarfile.open(fileobj=fp, mode='w:gz') as tar: with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile() as jrnl_fp: if (base.try_shell("journalctl > '%s'" % jrnl_fp.name) is not None): tar.add(jrnl_fp.name, arcname='journal') else: LOG.warn('failed to get system journal') for fname in files: if os.path.exists(fname): tar.add(fname) else: LOG.warn('log file %s does not exist', fname) fp.seek(0) return base64.b64encode(fp.read())

commit_message:
Download a compressed centos cloud images

The centos cloud images are both arround a GB in size, and
downloading them causes lot of CI timeouts, downloading the
compressed version saves 700MB of bandwith and should save
a lot of time.

Change-Id: I8dcd1db81fe5c4661945638ef3e6344fdf651243

subject: Fix filter name inconsistency in stack_list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-04 14:15:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/be89599cd8e695e66b58bd2ebc444bbba45c61fa', 'message': 'Fix filter name inconsistency in stack_list

As described in the bug report, filter names used in stack_list API are
not consistent with what users see when creating or retrieving stacks.
We cannot simply change the exposed filter key names because that will
break existing users.

This patch adds a translation logic from stack "property" like
'stack_name' to its corresponding db column name, i.e. 'name'. The
intent is to provide compatibility with existing use cases while
enforcing API consistency regarding the "properties" a user sees from
the API.

Change-Id: Ia6fe4345ca9feaf20c3bd020ff454e5d701a458e
Closes-Bug: 1461838
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-08 01:20:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/3f67e6a046dc37f238411a134505fa07582663da', 'message': 'Fix filter name inconsistency in stack_list

not consistent with what users see when creating or retrieving stacks.
We cannot simply change the exposed filter key names because that will
break existing users.

'stack_name' to its corresponding db column name, i.e. 'name'. The
intent is to provide compatibility with existing use cases while
enforcing API consistency regarding the "properties" a user sees from
the API.

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-06-17 14:01:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/1437748884ff3cd0e4a8323b441d25bd6fe16589', 'message': 'WIP: Fix filter name inconsistency in stack_list

As described in the bug report, filter names used in stack_list API are
not consistent with what users see when creating or retrieving stacks.
We cannot simply change the exposed filter key names because that will
break existing users.

This patch adds a translation logic from STACK_KEYS like 'stack_name' to
its corresponding db column name, i.e. 'name'. The intent is to provide
compatibility with existing use cases while enforcing API consistency
regarding the "properties" a user sees from the API.

Change-Id: Ia6fe4345ca9feaf20c3bd020ff454e5d701a458e
Closes-Bug: 1461838
'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2015-06-19 12:38:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/b248bb86345cf01940134572091208560847304a', 'message': 'Fix filter name inconsistency in stack_list

As described in the bug report, filter names used in stack_list API are
not consistent with what users see when creating or retrieving stacks.
We cannot simply change the exposed filter key names because that will
break existing users.

This patch adds a translation logic from STACK_KEYS like 'stack_name' to
its corresponding db column name, i.e. 'name'. The intent is to provide
compatibility with existing use cases while enforcing API consistency
regarding the "properties" a user sees from the API.

At engine API layer, we also try a simple parsing of the 'status' key,
which may be of simple form 'FAILED' or complex form 'CREATE_COMPLETE'.

Change-Id: Ia6fe4345ca9feaf20c3bd020ff454e5d701a458e
Closes-Bug: 1461838
'}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2015-06-21 06:16:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/1307134be4b5e5d262a6d707b1b01a143ca5f8ad', 'message': 'Fix filter name inconsistency in stack_list

commit_message:
Fix filter name inconsistency in stack_list

As described in the bug report, filter names used in stack_list API are
not consistent with what users see when creating or retrieving stacks.
We cannot simply change the exposed filter key names because that will
break existing users.

This patch adds a translation logic from STACK_KEYS like 'stack_name' to
its corresponding db column name, i.e. 'name'. The intent is to provide
compatibility with existing use cases while enforcing API consistency
regarding the "properties" a user sees from the API.

At engine API layer, we also try a simple parsing of the 'status' key,
which may be of simple form 'FAILED' or complex form 'CREATE_COMPLETE'.

Change-Id: Ia6fe4345ca9feaf20c3bd020ff454e5d701a458e
Closes-Bug: 1461838
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/11/188411/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _translate_filters(self, params): """Translate user-perceived keys to db field names. :param params: A dict of valid key-value pairs which may contain user perceived keys in addition to db field names. :returns: A dict with only db field names as keys. """ key_map = { 'stack_status': 'status', 'stack_name': 'name', 'stack_action': 'action', 'stack_owner': 'username', 'parent': 'owner_id', } for key, field in six.iteritems(key_map): value = params.pop(key, None) if not value: continue if not isinstance(value, list): value = [value] fld_value = params.get(field, None) if fld_value: if not isinstance(fld_value, list): fld_value = [fld_value] fld_value += value else: fld_value = value if len(fld_value) == 1: params[field] = fld_value[0] else: params[field] = fld_value return params # keys below are provided for api consistency 'stack_status': 'mixed', 'stack_name': 'mixed', 'stack_action': 'mixed', 'stack_owner': 'mixed', 'parent': 'mixed', filter_params = self._translate_filters(filter_params)

commit_message:
Python 3: Explicitly return parsed args as list

As part of porting to Python 3 parsing of args in "old" Parser
returned 'map' object which in Python 3 returns an iterator.
Now it is converted to list before returning.

Additionally all other failing tests were marked with 'xfail' and
all of them will be run - not only whitelisted.

Change-Id: Idb0683f7449d1ede22e73b80b06fd9508af30f5a

commit_message:
.mailmap for pbr AUTHORS upate

The AUTHORS file is regenerated by pbr automatically. There are a few
duplicate names in the git log history which caused the file to end up
with duplicates.
Additionaly some person haven't configured their git client to use First
Name / Last Name.

Introduce /.mailmap which pbr reads to alias or combine emails, see for
example:
https://github.com/openstack-dev/pbr/blob/master/.mailmap

When combining email addresses I took the one that had the most commit:

   2 Author: Lakshmi Kannan <lakshmi@stackstorm.com>
   1 Author: Lakshmi Kannan <lakshmi+github@lakshmikannan.me>

  21 Author: Winson Chan <wcchan@stackstorm.com>
   9 Author: Winson Chan <m4d.coder@gmail.com>
   4 Author: W Chan <wcchan@stackstorm.com>

The previous four last entries have been moved to match alphabetical
ordering.

Add myself since this patch is part of the repository.

Change-Id: I46b1e0e97bab87664a1c7a188898e52512b2fdf0

commit_message:
Sample auto-scaling template using monasca

Adds sample template which can be used to do auto-scaling
by using Monasca.

implements blueprint support-monasca-alarm-notification

Depends-On: I3e9e0ee69b863c1cadcff78eed822e3c3a75fbf6

Change-Id: Iff33b9359b30d76cac6ad9ce9263ff1eaf16c4ab

commit_message:
Don't get the image before deleting it

The client currently downloads the image metadata to check if it's deleted
or not. This logic belongs to the server and it's already implemented
there. Instead of getting the image, send the delete request and catch
the 404 error, which is already raised by the server.

Change-Id: I1e6ef42340f8e380ff99b9d6ca7ea416e0eebfbc
Closes-bug: #1496305

commit_message:
Add PRODUCTION: docker-build to astute.yaml

Currently production variable is taken from
version.yaml file. puppet uses this variable
to find out if it is run on the server or
it is just a part of the ISO build process.
This patch is a part of version.yaml
deprecation plan.

Change-Id: I175dc620cbdff3959519e3fc374894f93bba45ac
Implements: bp docker-images-perestroika

commit_message:
Fix the recommendation about file system of Ceph

The current document mentions that ceph developers recommend btrfs as a
fs for storage, however this is not the case as btrfs is not yet stable
for production clusters and only recommended in not critical
environments.

Change-Id: Ic8a977c6392e49c8516c27ea20374abc02abcb31
Closes-bug: #1491767
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/05/224105/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para>Ceph developers recommend XFS for production deployments, <systemitem>Rtrfs</systemitem> for testing, development, and any non-critical deployments. btrfs has the correct feature set and roadmap to serve Ceph in the long-term, but XFS and ext4 provide the necessary stability for today’s deployments.</para>
deleted_lines: <para>Ceph developers recommend that you use <systemitem>Btrfs</systemitem> as a file system for storage. XFS might be a better alternative for production environments;XFS is an excellent alternative to Btrfs. The ext4 file system is also compatible but does not exploit the power of Ceph.</para>

commit_message:
Fix two bugs in lb policy

This patch fixes two bugs in lb policy. 1) Using versioned profile
type; 2) Passing cluster object rather than id to _build_conn_params
method.

Change-Id: I200c2c97ec6856bb6661d6c804fb49185f26236d

commit_message:
Detect Image OS

Add the ability to detect the OS type/distribution/version inside
an image. This can be done with libguestfs.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/detect-image-os

Change-Id: I745c2523ca327e667609e92bb60ad367ff38b3db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/28/183628/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Detect image OS ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/detect-image-os Using libguestFS, we can determine the OS Type, Distribution, and Version of glance images, and then add this information to the image's properties metadata to aid in instance placement (Like Windows on Hyper-V), aid in billing (List instances using premium OS) or allow users to see all images of a certain os type regardless of name. Problem description =================== Today, it's not possible to know OS Type or Distribution or version unless the image has those properties set, or the name is very accurate. Without this information, cloud providers are unable to accurately track instance OS types. Billing based on "Premium" OS, like RHEL or Windows. Operators have no way of knowing if an image has an older OS that may require retirement, or security patching. Scheduling decisions based on OS can't be implemented without this information, like being able to hold all Windows OSs on Hyper-V instead of KVM. Proposed change =============== Instead of relying on end-users to correctly populate the metadata, or to name images in a meaningful manner, we should use libguestFS to inspect the OS/Distro/Version, and set these properties accordingly. Alternatives ------------ Presently, this is only able to be implemented at image build time, when a new image is created in glance, these OS properties can be set. This is flawed because it doesn't account for human error (Typo/omission). Data model impact ----------------- This would utilize the existing metadata "properties", and can be later migrated to use the native 'os_type' field that has been previously proposed. REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ The idea is to use an async worker to mitigate performance issues. Depending on the size of the image, detecting the OS may add some time to image processing. Other deployer impact --------------------- This would make libguestFS a requirement of glance. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <al592b> Other contributors: <retr0h> Reviewers --------- Core reviewer(s): None None Other reviewer(s): None None Work Items ---------- Identifiy minimum version of guestFS required. Implement async flow. Write tests Dependencies ============ libguestFS http://libguestfs.org Testing ======= This can be tested by inspecting a known image, such as CirrOS, and then populating the appropriate metadata for the image. Documentation Impact ==================== This would be a new feature, so should warrent some documentation. References ========== Presently implemented as a stand-alone project known as gleek (glance peek) https://github.com/alop/gleek This runs on a schedule, keeps a DB of known images, and populates metadata. This can be easily converted to fit inside glance async flows model.

commit_message:
Add test for LMA Infrastructure Alerting plugin

This change adds tests for the LMA Infrastructure Alerting [1] plugin.
It deploys also the LMA Collector [2] and the InfluxDB-Grafana [3] plugins
which provide the required source of information for the alert functionality.

[1] https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-plugin-lma-infrastructure-alerting
[2] https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-plugin-lma-collector
[3] https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-plugin-influxdb-grafana

Closes-bug: #1492220

Depends-On: I700c59c350942776b150d8f9c59bc0b92f3d037d
Depends-On: I4ffc73a643f0f8698a62e0606350060faf34e826

commit_message:
Set missing nullable fields

Older versions of Glance's won't return fields that are nullable. This
creates inconsistency between glance responses depending on what fields
are set in the image in the server.

Few patches have landed in the server to allow nullable fields to be
returned from the API. In order to make responses consistent and move
away from older versions of the API, this patch introduces a workaround
that sets such fields that are not returned by older versions of the
API.

The list of fields was taken from the patch that enabled such fields to
be returned in the server: I75da1e9309e0f7ef8839dea3ec9c99c58edc5d63

This list shouldn't be changed/deleted until these versions of the API
are marked as obsolete (or a better solution to this hack is found).

Closes-bug: #1398314
Change-Id: I558bff397d0837bb151993825c11fd0246ed43b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/36/140336/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(flaper87): This is a list of fields that are allowed # to be null in the server but weren't returned in API versions # prior to 2.3. This list is kept to introduce consistency between # older Glance's API and those >=2.3 when using glanceclient versions # released with this code in. # The goal os to always have these fields set even if they're None to # prevent consumers of this library from creating random hacks around # the inconsistency between responses. # # Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1398314 # Changes changed: 8b3ca087b7d3bbc1fb88daf6e780efbc1f0dcae8 _NONE_FIELDS = [ 'name', 'size', 'owner', 'checksum', 'disk_format', 'virtual_size', 'container_format', ] schema = self.schema_client.get('image').raw() # NOTE(flaper87): this is, by all means, a hack. # When interacting with older Glance versions, it'll # update the downloaded schema and allow some fields # to be None. This is used just for reads. # Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1398314 props = schema['properties'] for name, prop in props.items(): if 'type' not in prop: continue if name in _NONE_FIELDS and 'null' not in prop['type']: prop['type'] = ['null', prop['type']] if 'enum' in prop: prop['enum'].append(None) return warlock.model_factory(schema, schemas.SchemaBasedModel) yield self.model(__set_fields=_NONE_FIELDS, **image) return self.model(__set_fields=_NONE_FIELDS, **body) return self.model(__set_fields=_NONE_FIELDS, **body)
deleted_lines: schema = self.schema_client.get('image') return warlock.model_factory(schema.raw(), schemas.SchemaBasedModel) yield self.model(**image) return self.model(**body) return self.model(**body)

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-07 05:42:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/ee1cc15ed2e3808fe55a0237fa556b77a00ed29f', 'message': "[docs] Add plugin reference

We are adding single page that contains list of all plugins
with their description.

In future (next patches) we should do few things:

- Split this page into few pages, each page should
  contain only specific type of plugins

- Imporve descriptions of plugins that we have,
  especially description of context classes

- Add description to base plugin classes that expalins
  how everything works.
  So it won't be hardcoded in plugins.rst and it will
  be possilbe to use it in different places

Change-Id: I87ec6f8497392306578d91263c98c4c035acc521

commit_message:
[docs] Add plugin reference

This patch adds single page that contains
list of all plugins with their description.

In the future next things will be addressed:

- Split this page into few pages, each page should
  contain only specific type of plugins

- Improve descriptions of plugins that we have,
  especially description of context classes

- Add description to base plugin classes that expalins
  how everything works.
  So it won't be hardcoded in plugins.rst and it will
  be possilbe to use it in different places

Change-Id: I87ec6f8497392306578d91263c98c4c035acc521

commit_message:
Enable F812 and H904 style check

There are no shadowed variables in list comprehensions so
F812 can be enabled.
Also enable H904 because it was removed since hacking 0.10.0 [1]

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/hacking/tag/?id=0.10.0

Change-Id: I11e55066f2ec883c5706774d72c4f21b928ebde5

deleted_lines: # H904 Wrap long lines in parentheses instead of a backslash # F812 list comprehension redefines ignore = F812,H405,H904

commit_message:
Move import and export backup metadata to object

Encoding and decoding of backup metadata was being done in the backup
driver, but since this is not driver specific data we are talking about
it makes more sense to have this logic in the backup object.

This patch moves the logic to the object while still allowing to have
importing/exporting driver specific backup data, even when this is not
being used at the moment.

Related-Bug: #1455043
Related-Bug: #1476416
Change-Id: I690748e4542880d5e926f3cbf8cedfc86de5cb1f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/27/200927/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Export driver specific backup record information. If backup backend needs additional driver specific information to import backup record back into the system it must overwrite this method and return it here as a dictionary so it can be serialized into a string. Default backup driver implementation has no extra information. :param backup: backup object to export :returns driver_info - dictionary with extra information return {} def import_record(self, backup, driver_info): """Import driver specific backup record information. If backup backend needs additional driver specific information to import backup record back into the system it must overwrite this method since it will be called with the extra information that was provided by export_record when exporting the backup. Default backup driver implementation does nothing since it didn't export any specific data in export_record. :param backup: backup object to export :param driver_info: dictionary with driver specific backup record information return
deleted_lines: import base64 """Export backup record. Default backup driver implementation. Serialize the backup record describing the backup into a string. :param backup: backup entry to export :returns backup_url - a string describing the backup record retval = jsonutils.dumps(backup) if six.PY3: retval = retval.encode('utf-8') return base64.encodestring(retval) def import_record(self, backup_url): """Import and verify backup record. Default backup driver implementation. De-serialize the backup record into a dictionary, so we can update the database. :param backup_url: driver specific backup record string return jsonutils.loads(base64.decodestring(backup_url))

commit_message:
Create file /etc/default/neutron-server

Some neutron packages do not create the /etc/default/neutron-server
file, so we need to ensure that it exists to prevent errors when the
file_line resource is run.

Closes-bug: #1490438
Change-Id: I612e7fa5da7eebd8ae759e867eb8be5cebcdbe9d
(cherry picked from commit 55930cd62463ef76f4265a003b410e1c69bdfce7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/71/218771/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require => File['/etc/default/neutron-server','/etc/neutron/plugin.ini'], file {'/etc/default/neutron-server': ensure => present, owner => 'root', group => 'root', mode => '0644' } Package['neutron-plugin-ml2'] -> File['/etc/default/neutron-server'] Package['neutron'] -> File['/etc/default/neutron-server']

commit_message:
Fix neutron_agent_linuxbridge file path

Like the ML2 OpenVSwitch agent, the ML2 LinuxBridge agent defines its
config in ml2_conf.ini on Ubuntu. This patch updates the
neutron_agent_linuxbridge provider to behave the same as the
neutron_agent_ovs provider.

Closes-Bug: #1480277

Change-Id: I24462f9d04a07926c05790b80ed5f0064fcef97d
(cherry picked from commit d465022f426cfabb97a499e124c4e6ea288afc84)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/74/224274/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if Facter['operatingsystem'].value == 'Ubuntu' '/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini' else '/etc/neutron/plugins/linuxbridge/linuxbridge_conf.ini' end

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-21 15:43:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/206e58c2ecbd96b40e064188dec2a74b9fdff3e2', 'message': "Port Cisco Nexus/UCSM ExtraConfig to AllNodes

Switch the implemention from a pre_deploy ExtraConfig to an
AllNodesExtraConfig, so we can collect the mac->hostname mapping
for all nodes, then calculate a NexusConfig based on that and

commit_message:
Port Cisco Nexus/UCSM ExtraConfig to AllNodes

Switch the implemention from a pre_deploy ExtraConfig to an
AllNodesExtraConfig, so we can collect the mac->hostname mapping
for all nodes, then calculate a NexusConfig based on that and
a provided mapping of switch ports to mac address.
The same conversion is also done to the NetworkUCSMHostList:

The port mappings are provided via parameter_defaults like:

parameter_defaults:
  NetworkNexusConfig: {
    "bxb-tor-1": {
      "username": "admin",
      "ssh_port": 22,
      "password": "lab",
      "ip_address": "10.86.7.204",
      "nve_src_intf": 0,
      "physnet": "datacentre",
      "servers": {
        "fa:16:3e:fa:be:ef": "1/11",
        "fa:16:3e:fa:5e:cf": "1/23",
        "fa:16:3e:fa:12:34": "2/34"
      }
    }
  }
  NetworkUCSMHostList: 'fa:16:3e:fa:be:ef:profile1'

This results in an entry like this appended to
/etc/puppet/hieradata/neutron_cisco_data.yaml:

neutron::plugins::ml2::cisco::nexus::nexus_config:\
 {"bxb-tor-1": {"username": "admin", "nve_src_intf": 0, "ssh_port": 22,
"servers": {"overcloud-compute02": "2/34", "overcloud-compute01": "1/23",
"overcloud-control01": "1/11"}, "password": "lab", "ip_address": "10.86.7.204",
"physnet": "datacentre"}}
neutron::plugins::ml2::cisco::ucsm::ucsm_host_list: overcloud-control01:profile1

Co-Authored-By: Rob Pothier <rpothier@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tim Swanson <tiswanso@cisco.com>

Change-Id: I372c3ffb6bd85b7239fcb9f3fc4fa51cd4a39332

commit_message:
Add an ability to manage use_stderr parameter

When logging is already set up, it can be useful to disable this option
to avoid logs duplication (collected by Upstart, for example)

Change-Id: I6c3e33e8ac3b018941eb0a1c584701c4483a3a11
Closes-bug: #1482564
(cherry picked from commit 985c48951b42810cbfcf3a077c8773a8787fa6d2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/45/223945/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :use_stderr => 'True', it 'configures use_stderr option' do is_expected.to contain_ceilometer_config('DEFAULT/use_stderr').with_value( params[:use_stderr] ) end

commit_message:
Add "AllNodes" ExtraConfig interface

Adds hook to enable additional "AllNodes" config to be performed prior
to applying puppet - this is useful when you need to build
configuration data which requires knowledge of all nodes in a cluster,
or of the entire deployment.

As an example, there is a sample config template which collects the
hostname and mac addresses for all nodes in the deployment then writes
the data to all Controller nodes.  Something similar to this may be
required to enable creation of the nexus_config in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198754/

There's also another, simpler, example which shows how you could share
the output of an OS::Heat::RandomString between nodes.

Change-Id: I8342a238f50142d8c7426f2b96f4ef1635775509
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/40/214740/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: 2014-10-16 description: > Example extra config for cluster config this example collects the hostname and MAC addresses for each node in the cluster, then distributes that info to all nodes in the cluster # Note extra parameters can be defined, then passed data via the # environment parameter_defaults, without modifying the parent template parameters: servers: type: json resources: CollectMacConfig: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: script config: | #!/bin/sh MACS=$(ifconfig | grep ether | awk '{print $2}' | tr "\n" " ") HOSTNAME=$(hostname -s) echo "$HOSTNAME $MACS" CollectMacDeployments: type: OS::Heat::StructuredDeployments properties: servers: {get_param: servers} config: {get_resource: CollectMacConfig} actions: ['CREATE'] # Only do this on CREATE DistributeMacConfig: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: group: script inputs: - name: mappings config: | #!/bin/sh echo $mappings > /root/mappings echo "mappings = $mappings" DistributeMacDeployments: type: OS::Heat::StructuredDeployments properties: servers: {get_param: servers} config: {get_resource: DistributeMacConfig} input_values: mappings: {get_attr: [CollectMacDeployments, deploy_stdouts]} actions: ['CREATE'] # Only do this on CREATE

commit_message:
Add an ability to manage use_stderr parameter

When logging is already set up, it can be useful to disable this option
to avoid logs duplication (collected by Upstart, for example)

Change-Id: I1787191d9a512fdd3c3f79d6fadda110c5e41d54
Closes-bug: #1482564
(cherry picked from commit 1f4a545247049eebff60d7946fe3f648fce583b6)

added_lines: :use_stderr => true, describe 'with use_stderr enabled (default)' do let(:params) { default_params } it { is_expected.to contain_glance_registry_config('DEFAULT/use_stderr').with_value('true')} end

commit_message:
Revert "Additional unit tests for update-preview"

Both of these tests appear to have races which cause gate
failures. This is affecting RC1 changes landing so lets
revert for now while it is investigated.

This reverts commit 92107789ad28da86b877e1d0c35cb0c7a8e9e437.
Closes-Bug: #1496886

Change-Id: I411be70ab88e05ad9dc79b3bf147b282bbda34b0

	"June 13th, 2013

	jTweetsAnywhere stopped working since Twitter moved from API Version 1.0

commit_message:
Remove unused jTweetsAnywhere

jTweetsAnywhere is not used anywhere and if you look at the home page at
http://thomasbillenstein.com/jTweetsAnywhere/, you see that it does not
even work anymore:

	"June 13th, 2013

	jTweetsAnywhere stopped working since Twitter moved from API Version 1.0
	to 1.1 and now turned off V1.0."

Remove it completely, we don't use it and will not use it as is.

Change-Id: I5ab0206907ec3889614860906198c93f868780b6

commit_message:
projects/puppet: add puppet-aodh

Ceilometer has now its own project for Alarming, that contains
specific configuration files, services, endpoints, etc.

It requires a new Puppet module to be created and be part of
Puppet OpenStack modules.

Depends-On: Iaf64f4d1d2e52e671032091efab0494f6ce59a4f
Change-Id: I7d1804e1c9234a097c3369558c427b03e364bfc4

commit_message:
Add support for grant_type "authorization_code"

This is the prototype code for supporting grant_type "authorization_
code" when we use OpenID Connect as Idp to continue OpenStack work.

Change-Id: I243c4803522e6bf9ad84ba0464eae523c5ff05d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/46/223946/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: access_token_endpoint, redirect_uri, code, scope='profile', grant_type='password', access_token_type='access_token'): :param redirect_uri: OpenID Connect Client Redirect Uri :type redirect_uri: string :param code: OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code :type code: string :param access_token_type: OAuth 2.0 Authorization Server Introspection token type, it is used to decide which type of token will be used when processing token introspection. Valid values are: "access_token" or "id_token" :type access_token_type: string self.redirect_uri = redirect_uri self.code = code self.access_token_type = access_token_type if self.grant_type == 'authorization_code': payload = {'grant_type': self.grant_type, 'redirect_uri': self.redirect_uri, 'code': self.code} else: payload = {'grant_type': self.grant_type, 'username': self.username, 'password': self.password, 'scope': self.scope} access_token = response.json()[self.access_token_type] # use access token against protected URL headers = {'Authorization': 'Bearer ' + access_token} response = self._get_keystone_token(session, headers, self.federated_token_url) # grab the unscoped token token = response.headers['X-Subject-Token'] token_json = response.json()['token'] return access.AccessInfoV3(token, **token_json) def _get_access_token(self, session, client_auth, payload, access_token_endpoint): """Exchange a variety of user supplied values for an access token. :param session: a session object to send out HTTP requests. :type session: keystoneclient.session.Session :param client_auth: a tuple representing client id and secret :type client_auth: tuple :param payload: a dict containing various OpenID Connect values, for example:: {'grant_type': 'password', 'username': self.username, 'password': self.password, 'scope': self.scope} :type payload: dict :param access_token_endpoint: URL to use to get an access token, for example: https://localhost/oidc/token :type access_token_endpoint: string """ op_response = session.post(self.access_token_endpoint, requests_auth=client_auth, data=payload, authenticated=False) return op_response def _get_keystone_token(self, session, headers, federated_token_url): """Exchange an acess token for a keystone token. By Sending the access token in an `Authorization: Bearer` header, to an OpenID Connect protected endpoint (Federated Token URL). The OpenID Connect server will use the access token to look up information about the authenticated user (this technique is called instrospection). The output of the instrospection will be an OpenID Connect Claim, that will be used against the mapping engine. Should the mapping engine succeed, a Keystone token will be presented to the user. :param session: a session object to send out HTTP requests. :type session: keystoneclient.session.Session :param headers: an Authorization header containing the access token. :type headers_: dict :param federated_auth_url: Protected URL for federated authentication, for example: https://localhost:5000/v3/\ OS-FEDERATION/identity_providers/bluepages/\ protocols/oidc/auth :type federated_auth_url: string """ auth_response = session.post(self.federated_token_url, headers=headers, authenticated=False) return auth_response class OidcAuthorizationCode(federated.FederatedBaseAuth): """Implement authentication plugin for OpenID Connect protocol. OIDC or OpenID Connect is a protocol for federated authentication. The OpenID Connect specification can be found at:: ``http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html`` """ @classmethod def get_options(cls): options = super(OidcAuthorizationCode, cls).get_options() options.extend([ cfg.StrOpt('client-id', help='OAuth 2.0 Client ID'), cfg.StrOpt('client-secret', help='OAuth 2.0 Client Secret'), cfg.StrOpt('access-token-endpoint', help='OpenID Connect Provider Token Endpoint'), cfg.StrOpt('redirect-uri', help='OpenID Connect Client Redirect URI'), cfg.StrOpt('code', help='OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code'), cfg.StrOpt('grant-type', default='authorization_code', help='OpenID Connect grant type'), cfg.StrOpt('scope', default="profile", help='OpenID Connect scope that is requested from OP') ]) return options @utils.positional(4) def __init__(self, auth_url, identity_provider, protocol, client_id, client_secret, access_token_endpoint, redirect_uri, code, scope='profile',grant_type='authorization_code'): """The OpenID Connect plugin expects the following: :param auth_url: URL of the Identity Service :type auth_url: string :param identity_provider: Name of the Identity Provider the client will authenticate against :type identity_provider: string :param protocol: Protocol name as configured in keystone :type protocol: string :param client_id: OAuth 2.0 Client ID :type client_id: string :param client_secret: OAuth 2.0 Client Secret :type client_secret: string :param access_token_endpoint: OpenID Connect Provider Token Endpoint, for example: https://localhost:8020/oidc/OP/token :type access_token_endpoint: string :param redirect_uri: OpenID Connect Client Redirect URI :type redirect_uri: string :param code: OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code :type code: string :param scope: OpenID Connect scope that is requested from OP, defaults to "profile", for example: "profile email" :type scope: string :param grant_type: OpenID Connect grant type, it represents the flow that is used to talk to the OP. Valid values are: "authorization_code", "refresh_token", or "password". :type grant_type: string """ super(OidcAuthorizationCode, self).__init__(auth_url, identity_provider, protocol) self.client_id = client_id self.client_secret = client_secret self.access_token_endpoint = access_token_endpoint self.redirect_uri = redirect_uri self.code = code self.scope = scope self.grant_type = grant_type def get_unscoped_auth_ref(self, session): """Authenticate with OpenID Connect and get back claims. This is a multi-step process. First an access token must be retrieved, to do this, the OpenID Connect client ID and secret, and the access token endpoint must be known. Secondly, we then exchange the access token upon accessing the protected Keystone endpoint (federated auth URL). This will trigger the OpenID Connect Provider to perform a user introspection and retrieve information (specified in the scope) about the user in the form of an OpenID Connect Claim. These claims will be sent to Keystone in the form of environment variables. :param session: a session object to send out HTTP requests. :type session: keystoneclient.session.Session :returns: a token data representation :rtype: :py:class:`keystoneclient.access.AccessInfo` """ # get an access token client_auth = (self.client_id, self.client_secret) payload = {'grant_type': self.grant_type, 'code': self.code, 'redirect_uri': self.redirect_uri} response = self._get_access_token(session, client_auth, payload, self.access_token_endpoint) access_token = response.json()['id_token']
deleted_lines: access_token_endpoint, scope='profile', grant_type='password'): payload = {'grant_type': self.grant_type, 'username': self.username, 'password': self.password, 'scope': self.scope} access_token = response.json()['access_token']

commit_message:
Made network detail status and admin state translatable

The "Status" and "Admin State" labels on the Network Details panel
in both the Project and Admin dashboards are currently
untranslatable.  This change fixes that issue and allows
these labels to be translated.

Change-Id: Iaf5c0b84882683244793438c30b81d4329e94c0d
Partial-Bug: #1441366

commit_message:
Fix angular pie charts appearance

The recent pie charts scss changes made as part of
horizon-theme-css-reorg improved the overall theming capabilities, but
broke a bit layout of pie charts used inside angularized Launch
Instance NG. That's caused by the fact that both types of pie charts
use .pie-chart - but for different subelements. Angular pie chart
marks the top-level chart element with it (the one which contains
title, chart and legend), while legacy pie charts use this class for
the chart's svg. This patch fixes that by renaming the class name of
legacy pie charts both in scss and horizon.d3piechart.js.

Change-Id: Ie803cb7bffdd9cfc508035e16d8e06d284d2f0f0
Closes-Bug: #1493426

commit_message:
Check element's existence in angular unit tests in a proper way

An assertion `expect(element.find(someSelector)).toBeDefined()` is
always true due to implementation of jQuery selectors. The assertion
that could actually catch something has the form
`expect(element.find(someSelector).length).toBe(1)`.

Change-Id: I52c48e26d87072731f689c136a00a4140a7afb3b
Closes-Bug: #1493354

commit_message:
Hide 'Gateway IP' input when 'Disable Gateway' is checked

When updating subnet, 'Gateway IP' input is not hidden if 'Disable
Gateway' checkbox is checked as 'Create Network' wizard do.

Change-Id: Ie6a1dbc645eb566a680a6f6dec316d5077f8645d
Closes-bug: #1484025
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/07/211907/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: widget=forms.TextInput(attrs={ 'class': 'switched', 'data-switch-on': 'with_subnet gateway_ip' }), widget=forms.CheckboxInput(attrs={ 'class': 'switched switchable', 'data-slug': 'gateway_ip', 'data-switch-on': 'with_subnet', 'data-hide-on-checked': 'true' }),

commit_message:
Fix cinder-all binary

1. Add rpc.init for cinder-api service
2. Add multi-backend support for cinder-volume service

Closes-Bug: #1496154
Change-Id: I91626bd74fc224302e131c5235030a02431a04c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/51/223851/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import cinder.cmd.volume # noqafrom cinder import rpc rpc.init(CONF) for binary in ['cinder-scheduler', 'cinder-backup']: # cinder-volume if CONF.enabled_backends: for backend in CONF.enabled_backends: CONF.register_opt(host_opt, group=backend) backend_host = getattr(CONF, backend).backend_host host = "%s@%s" % (backend_host or CONF.host, backend) server = service.Service.create(host=host, service_name=backend, binary='cinder-volume') # Dispose of the whole DB connection pool here before # starting another process. Otherwise we run into cases where # child processes share DB connections which results in errors. session.dispose_engine() launcher.launch_service(server) else: server = service.Service.create(binary='cinder-volume') launcher.launch_service(server)

make gate-puppet-ironic-puppet-beaker-rspec-dsvm-trusty voting

Let's enable again the vote.

subject: Add usage of 'os.path.expanduser' to file_exists validator
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-07 16:38:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/4dda573fcc809140711d3da762b67711d06545d5', 'message': "Add usage of 'os.path.expanduser' to file_exists validator

Change-Id: I9eed8e17e138eaf939c30c20896ad92f1aa1254f
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-08 08:51:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/ffe727e70b247ed1ca4c2cf40418aea90f52dc59', 'message': "Add new class 'FilePath' to types.py

To make scenarios more flexible hardcoded paths to scenarios'
resources were changes (e.g '/home/jenkins/file.file' -> '~/file.file').
It leads to changes in code and addition of os.path.expanduser() method
in some functions, but there are places where such hack was missed,
for example in 'file_exists' decorator. Because of it some scenarios
became failed. To avoid it in future there was added one more type
that transform input path and return expanded one.

Change-Id: I9eed8e17e138eaf939c30c20896ad92f1aa1254f
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-08 10:01:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/711e664bb48e670a8aefd5178706103f3127fa65', 'message': "Add new class 'FilePath' to types.py

To make scenarios more flexible hardcoded paths to scenarios'
resources were changes (e.g '/home/jenkins/file.file' -> '~/file.file').
It leads to changes in code and addition of os.path.expanduser() method
in some functions, but there are places where such hack was missed,
for example in 'file_exists' decorator. Because of it some scenarios
became failed. To avoid it in future there was added one more type
that transform input path and return expanded one.

Change-Id: I9eed8e17e138eaf939c30c20896ad92f1aa1254f
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-08 11:09:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/305ccf06f09286b67a823c79f3b9834779760eff', 'message': "Add new class 'FilePath' to types.py

To make scenarios more flexible hardcoded paths to scenarios'
resources were changes (e.g '/home/jenkins/file.file' -> '~/file.file').
It leads to changes in code and addition of os.path.expanduser() method
in some functions, but there are places where such hack was missed,
for example in 'file_exists' decorator. Because of it some scenarios
became failed. To avoid it in future there was added one more type
that transform input path and return expanded one.

Change-Id: I9eed8e17e138eaf939c30c20896ad92f1aa1254f
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-14 10:45:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/15bd711582e69443fd4f9109046bd6eba55be119', 'message': "Add usage of 'os.path.expanduser' to file_exists validator

Change-Id: I9eed8e17e138eaf939c30c20896ad92f1aa1254f
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-09-17 11:15:51.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/validation.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/1483d6e687facd89f35b496bcbd36c6b255041f8', 'message': "Add usage of 'os.path.expanduser' to file_exists validator

Change-Id: I9eed8e17e138eaf939c30c20896ad92f1aa1254f
"}]

commit_message:
[Reports] Add Load Profile chart to report

Process iterations timestamps and display a chart with
number of parallel iterations for each benchmark moment.

Co-Authored-By: Yair Fried <yfried@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Aleksandr Maretskiy <amaretskiy@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ie902c41b432c09a5e48562ed64b30c75df7f2745
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/28/169828/25 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: load_profile = charts.LoadProfileChart( iteration_to_values=lambda x: [(x["timestamp"], x["duration"])], name="parallel working iterations", tstamp_start=meta["tstamp_start"], duration=scenario["data"]["load_duration"]) load_profile.add_iteration(itr) "load_profile": [i for i in load_profile.render() if i["values"] ] or None,

commit_message:
Fix gate-rally-dsvm-zaqar-zaqar

Rally gate for Zaqar was failing because the Zaqar plugin was not
being enabled in rally.yaml

Change-Id: I86ffcae5b720f943ffea6ef6c0292733f11a013f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/70/223770/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+="enable_plugin zaqar git://git.openstack.org/openstack/zaqar"

commit_message:
Create puppet-aodh repository

Ceilometer has now its own project for Alarming, that contains
specific configuration files, services, endpoints, etc.

It requires a new Puppet module to be created and be part of
Puppet OpenStack modules.

Source: https://github.com/openstack/aodh
Change-Id: Iaf64f4d1d2e52e671032091efab0494f6ce59a4f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/89/222289/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: openstack/puppet-aodh template: - name: merge-check - name: puppet-check-jobs - name: puppet-module-unit-jobs - name: puppet-beaker-jobs - name: puppet-beaker-upgrade-jobs

commit_message:
Job execution cancel timeout

The bug is introduced by change I2cc4309a7b0436506a6e809f2690d9e132c0dc50.

When running edp jobs, we only need to delete job from edp engine if
exceptions are raised after the job run.

Change-Id: I4b5e971edfbceb66c80255a6bfc42ebed0dc0b65
Closes-bug: 1473234
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/63/208863/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: # Job id is a string # Status is a string # Extra is a dictionary to add to extra in the job_execution jid, status, extra = eng.run_job(job_execution) except Exception as error: update_dict = {'start_time': datetime.datetime.now(), 'end_time': datetime.datetime.now()} update_dict['info'] = {'status': edp.JOB_STATUS_DONEWITHERROR, 'error_code': error.code, 'error_message': error.message} return conductor.job_execution_update( ctx, job_execution, update_dict) if job_execution.oozie_job_id is None: job_info = { 'status': edp.JOB_STATUS_KILLED } job_execution = _write_job_status(job_execution, job_info) LOG.info(_LI("Job execution was canceled successfully")) return job_execution
deleted_lines: # Job id is a string # Status is a string # Extra is a dictionary to add to extra in the job_execution jid, status, extra = eng.run_job(job_execution)

subject: Rename oozie_job_id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-27 07:37:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara/commit/4548d9448ce5d7468165637608477e9bf7507a59', 'message': 'Rename oozie_job_id

The "oozie_job_id" column in table "job_executions" represents
oozie_job_id only when the edp engine is oozie. When it is spark
engin, oozie_job_id = pid@instance_id, when it is storm engine,
oozie_job_id = topology_name@instance_id.

Rename oozie_job_id to engine_job_id to aviod confusing.

Change-Id: I2671b91a315b2c7a2b805ce4d494252860a7fe6c

commit_message:
Rename oozie_job_id

The "oozie_job_id" column in table "job_executions" represents
oozie_job_id only when the edp engine is oozie. When it is spark
engin, oozie_job_id = pid@instance_id, when it is storm engine,
oozie_job_id = topology_name@instance_id.

Rename oozie_job_id to engine_job_id to aviod confusing.

Change-Id: I2671b91a315b2c7a2b805ce4d494252860a7fe6c
Closes-bug: 1479575

commit_message:
Move volume types Forms out of volumes

As we already moved volume types related codes to a separate
directory, it's strange to still leave CreateVolumeType and
CreateQosSpec forms to volumes

Change-Id: Iaa071dae5f13ecb92a1cbda0d9d8496ab18dc2b2

added_lines: from django.forms import ValidationError # noqaclass CreateVolumeType(forms.SelfHandlingForm): name = forms.CharField(max_length=255, label=_("Name")) vol_type_description = forms.CharField( max_length=255, widget=forms.Textarea( attrs={'class': 'modal-body-fixed-width', 'rows': 4}), label=_("Description"), required=False) def clean_name(self): cleaned_name = self.cleaned_data['name'] if len(cleaned_name.strip()) == 0: raise ValidationError(_('Volume type name can not be empty.')) return cleaned_name def handle(self, request, data): try: # Remove any new lines in the public key volume_type = cinder.volume_type_create( request, data['name'], data['vol_type_description']) messages.success(request, _('Successfully created volume type: %s') % data['name']) return volume_type except Exception: redirect = reverse("horizon:admin:volumes:index") exceptions.handle(request, _('Unable to create volume type.'), redirect=redirect) class CreateQosSpec(forms.SelfHandlingForm): name = forms.CharField(max_length=255, label=_("Name")) consumer = forms.ChoiceField(label=_("Consumer"), choices=cinder.CONSUMER_CHOICES) def handle(self, request, data): try: qos_spec = cinder.qos_spec_create(request, data['name'], {'consumer': data['consumer']}) messages.success(request, _('Successfully created QoS Spec: %s') % data['name']) return qos_spec except Exception: redirect = reverse("horizon:admin:volumes:index") exceptions.handle(request, _('Unable to create QoS Spec.'), redirect=redirect)

commit_message:
Update Trove CLI doc to version 1.3.0

Trove recently release version 1.3.0 of the python client:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-troveclient

The CLI documention has been updated to reflect the new release.

Change-Id: I41f31057ecc4756cf2845d9eee96d7ccea3886ff
Closes-Bug: #1496576

commit_message:
Disable gate-grenade-dsvm-ceilometer in stable/juno

Doing a grenade from icehouse to juno just doesn't make sense as we
deleted all the icehouse branches.

Closes-Bug: 1497077

commit_message:
Sync cobbler settings after patching bootstrap initramfs

Otherwise, seed controllers will boot from old bootstrap image, and might break
volumes schema.

Change-Id: I5386ffe8dd9e767a60d06c2e72cb1dcffe34f1ad

commit_message:
Don't stop platform services via corosync

Platform services managed by corosync must not be stopped in maintenance mode:

* p_rabbitmq-server
* p_conntrackd
* p_vrouter

Change-Id: I02663d93121c2087c4b768e60018e64ffd99217b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/72/224572/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _default_exclude_services = ('p_mysql', 'p_haproxy', 'p_dns', 'p_ntp', 'vip', 'p_conntrackd', 'p_rabbitmq-server', 'p_vrouter')

Replace 'exist_ok' flag with classic 'if' statement

commit_message:
Remove extra DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG from rally

The devstack-rally-gate was setting DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG and
overwriting it later. Remove the first - and wrong! - setting.

Change-Id: I84606aac6114243128ff6200712d8dd36674723a

commit_message:
Add unit test for floating_ips_client

We have a plan to migrate service clients to tempest-lib from Tempest.
However, we are not doing enough tests for service clients now.
This patch adds unit test for floating_ips_client.

Change-Id: Ibbb6439d31f5379bcb5e92e8bf49bcab9ad51a0f

commit_message:
Fix backup list all_tenants=0 filtering for admin

When a user with admin role lists backups specifying all_tenants=0 in
the request, it will not behave as expected, it will return backups for
all tenants just as if all_tenants=1 had been specified.

This patch fixes this issue and will only return all tenants in backup
listings if all_tenants is set to a value meaning True (1, true, yes,
y).

Change-Id: Ia74bc258a86f6dc48483dfe17bf5a312aec4058d
Closes-Bug: #1485900

commit_message:
Add barbicanclient clone back (was overzealous in pruning)

I919487f3490f769ffdad036024033e1f991a7ecd correctly removed the extra
barbican clone, but I was overzealous in removing the
python-barbicanclient clone which IS still necessary, because it is not
pulled in by zuul automatically.

Change-Id: Ic28852572f4e2adab9a0e775f82269c588a2a138

commit_message:
Prevent stevedore ext errors when glance tests run

When running glance unit tests using run_tests.sh,
there is series of error thrown from stevedore extensions
stating that it cannot load 'swift' module from python-swiftclient.
By default python-swiftclient is not installed by glance and it uses
the file system as it default glance store.

This minor fix helps to avoid the default dependency on 'swift'
module and to load it only when using python-swiftclient just like
its done for other glance stores.

Closes-bug: #1496935
Change-Id: I5936bc19546bc90d863f3e2438f35085f63b1c57

commit_message:
Ban oslo.utils 1.4.1 from kilo

In osloutils 1.4.1 was release[1] which includes the g-r caps from juno
stable/kilo This is a valid release according to the kilo g-r

The requirements for Babel are incompatible.

As a quick fix ban 1.4.1 from kilo until a better fix can be found.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/223909/

Change-Id: I15be9e2c81338ac9602ffc8b12de279d1e7cc97e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/29/224429/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
IDP specific websso

Allow handling websso requests per IDP.

Change-Id: Ie20e21eb95c2250e301165012eef5591243620e9
Implements: bp federation-idp-websso
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/django_openstack_auth refs/changes/41/219041/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_websso_url(request, auth_url, websso_auth): """Return the identity endpoint for WebSSO.""" origin = build_absolute_uri(request, '/auth/websso/') idp_mapping = getattr(settings, 'WEBSSO_IDP_MAPPING', {}) idp_id, protocol_id = idp_mapping.get(websso_auth, (None, websso_auth)) if idp_id is None: # If no IDP mapping found for the identifier, # perform WebSSO by protocol. url = ('%s/auth/OS-FEDERATION/websso/%s?origin=%s' % (auth_url, protocol_id, origin)) else: # Use the IDP specific WebSSO endpoint url = ('%s/auth/OS-FEDERATION/identity_providers/%s' '/protocols/%s/websso?origin=%s' % (auth_url, idp_id, protocol_id, origin)) return url

commit_message:
Allow user to add the description file to sahara image

Sahara-image-elements create a description file for each image.
This description file contains details of elements have been build
into images along with other related infomation.

This is the client side change to allow user to add the description
file to sahara image when do image-register.

Change-Id: I5d8b832608f5ca1d7153e21078886681b636434e
Partial-Implements: bp expose-elements
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-saharaclient refs/changes/06/193006/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [--file <description.json>]@utils.arg('--file', metavar='<decs_file>', help='A description file of image in json format, it can be auto\ generated by sahara-image-element.') others={} image={} if args.file: with open(args.file) as json_file: others=json.load(json_file) image=others.get('image', None) others.pop('image') if not args.username: if not image: args.username='root' else: args.username=image.get('username', 'root') cs.images.update_image(args.id, args.username, args.description, others)

Allow user to add the description file to sahara image

Sahara-image-elements create a description file for each image.

into images along with other related infomation.

This change allow user to add the description file to sahara image
when do image-register.

commit_message:
Add lib type job binaries

Spec which describes add lib type job binaries.

Change-Id: I406a4b277275252c8d17dc095cfa7a82fb8b8eaa
Partial-Implements: bp add-lib-type-job-binaries
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/97/184197/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================= Add lib type job binaries ========================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/add-lib-type-job-binaries This spec is to add a new lib type job binary. Problem description =================== Currently Sahara user can create job binaries to run jobs. All job binaries are been managed in one table, and listed in one page in UI. There is a type of job binaries which used by users at a high frequency, such as third party libs. These job binaries might be used in many jobs and can be shared by multiple users. Proposed change =============== 1. Add a new flag for job_binaries named "is_lib". User can set this flag to indicate the job binary is a lib. 2. Add a new flag for job_binaries named "is_public". Only admin can set this flag, and must be set with "is_lib" All users in the same tenant can share these job binaries. Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- 1. Add a new bool columns for job_binaries named "is_lib" 2. Add a new bool columns for job_binaries named "is_public" REST API impact --------------- Allow user to set "lib" & "public" for job binaries. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Deployer impact --------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- None. Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- 1. Add two tabs in Job Binaries Panel. libs shows user created job binaries with a lib type. public libs whos job binaries created by admin, user can use. 2. Allow user to set "lib" & "public" when create a job binary. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: chen-li (Li, Chen) Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Update job binaries create/update API with "lib" & "public" * Update saharaclient * Update dashboard * Documentation Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= None. Documentation Impact ==================== Need to be documented. References ========== None.

commit_message:
Expose supported elements for clusters

Spec which describes expose supported elements for clusters implementations

Change-Id: If87677475a2fbc1f83f6f680d0a4b4b13b721834
Partial-Implements: bp expose-elements
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/92/178892/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================================== Add supported elements for cluster ===================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/add-config-for-elements This spec is to add a new attribute for a cluster which shows its supported elements. Problem description =================== We have more and more elements which have been supported by running clusters and every elements need to be built into images. Cluster building time is become longer and longer and images are becoming bigger and bigger, but not every element would be used by every user. Proposed change =============== 1. A running cluster would have a new attribute which indicates its supported elements. a. User can set elements in cluster template, empty value means supported elements dependent on its image. b. When user create a cluster with one image, we should check if all requested processes/elements are supported by current image. c. When user run a job, we should check whether current job is runnable. For example, when user run a hbase job, if the cluster do not support hbase, error would be raised. 2. Request user to add a "supported elements" tag for image a. When user do image-register in Sahara, it "MUST" add a tag for supported elements. b. When sahara do image-register, it will accept 2 parameters, the image file location and a config file for the image. Sahara should help user to upload the image into glance, and use the conf file to add metadata for the image automatically. Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- Need to add a column to store cluster supported elements. REST API impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Deployer impact --------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- Introduce an input parameter for "diskimage-create.sh" to build supported elements into the image. For example: diskimage-create.sh -s max (install all supported elements) diskimage-create.sh -s min (only install elements which are needed for every user, e.g. onlt hdfs and yarn) diskimage-create.sh -s --list=hbase,extjs,daal (allow user to name elements which are wanted) diskimage-create.sh (install recommended elements) Allow user to name its image: diskimage-create.sh -n $image_name Create a directory $image_name, and put image into the directory with a description file, which contains: name:$image_name plugin: vanilla hadoop version: 2 os: centos supported elements: hdfs,yarn,hbase,extjs,daal Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- Horizon need to be updated to display supported elements for clusters. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: chen-li (Li, Chen) Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Implement feature * Document feature Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= New unit tests and integration tests should be written for the feature. Documentation Impact ==================== List of supported elements, their name and abilities. References ========== None

commit_message:
Remove the dict check for body[entity_name]

Although VersionedObject provide dictionary key access compat,
it do not support "obj.get(None)".

Also, with the implementation of VersionedObject, the type of
body[entity_name] should be change from dict to VersionedObject.

Change-Id: I965fe36ea43273ebf6283052075e8644000f7fcb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/40/174740/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (chen) TODO: # The body[entity_name] should be an VersionedObject # after we implemented VersionedObject. # It should be checked like: # if not isinstance(result, VersionedObject): # return False
deleted_lines: def is_dict(d): try: d.get(None) return True except AttributeError: return False if not is_dict(body[entity_name]): return False

Versioned objects - SecurityService

Implementation for versioned objects. This contains SecurityService.

Change-Id: Ia92e068613ae3fee218e18b19593e33865a46130
Implements: blueprint versioned-objects

added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Intel Corp. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Security Service object """ from oslo_versionedobjects import base from oslo_versionedobjects import fields from manila.db import api as db_api class SecurityService( base.VersionedObject, base.VersionedObjectDictCompat, ): fields = { 'id': fields.StringField(), 'deleted': fields.StringField(), 'project_id': fields.StringField(), 'type': fields.StringField(), 'dns_ip': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'server': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'domain': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'user': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'password': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'name': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'description': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'status': fields.StringField(), 'created_at': fields.DateTimeField(read_only=True), 'updated_at': fields.DateTimeField(nullable=True), 'deleted_at': fields.DateTimeField(nullable=True), } @staticmethod def _from_db_object(context, ss, db_ss): for field in ss.fields: ss[field] = db_ss[field] ss._context = context ss.obj_reset_changes() return ss @classmethod def create(cls, context, values): db_ss = db_api.security_service_create(context, values) ss = cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), db_ss) return ss @classmethod def delete(cls, context, id): return db_api.security_service_delete(context, id) @classmethod def update(cls, context, id, values): db_ss = db_api.security_service_update(context, id, values) ss = cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), db_ss) return ss @classmethod def get(cls, context, id, session=None): db_ss = db_api.security_service_get(context, id, session) ss = cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), db_ss) return ss @classmethod def get_all(cls, context): db_sss = db_api.security_service_get_all(context) sss = map( lambda db_ss: cls._from_db_object( context, cls(), db_ss), db_sss) return sss @classmethod def get_all_by_project(cls, context, project_id): db_sss = db_api.security_service_get_all_by_project( context, project_id) sss = map( lambda db_ss: cls._from_db_object( context, cls(), db_ss), db_sss) return sss

commit_message:
Implement versioned object for share export locations

This is the first object of Manila.

Implementation of oslo.versionedobjects.
Add first object: ShareExportLocation & ShareExportLocationList.
Use the new object instead of direct db_api.

Partially Implements: blueprint versioned-objects

Change-Id: Ia277f6a347a1332a0142ca924ea1c8ed8b3b987c

commit_message:
Add create_and_update_secgroups scenario

Add scenario that creates N security groups and then updates their
name and description.Also added  supporting method '_update_security_groups'
to "rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/utils.py".

Change-Id: Ieff30655cc04e66a85bb6dfd7c3f90f59ac14384
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/61/209761/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test__update_security_groups(self): nova_scenario = utils.NovaScenario() fake_secgroups = [fakes.FakeSecurityGroup(None, None, 1, "uuid1"), fakes.FakeSecurityGroup(None, None, 2, "uuid2")] nova_scenario._update_security_groups(fake_secgroups) self.assertEqual( len(fake_secgroups), self.clients("nova").security_groups.update.call_count) self._test_atomic_action_timer( nova_scenario.atomic_actions(), "nova.update_%s_security_groups" % len(fake_secgroups))

commit_message:
Additional unit tests for update-preview

Now that OS::Heat::TestResource has a _needs_update() method,
update-preview correctly shows the resource as "replaced" whenever the
update_replace property is set to true.  Also, add an update_not_allowed
property to OS::Heat::TestResource and a corresponding unit test to test
properties with update_allowed set to False.

Change-Id: I75c4982f0c8eb29ec5ce4287b63ccbb8af25bfef
Partial-Bug: #1494436

commit_message:
Issue deprecation warning if domain_id not specified in create call

Due to a long-fixed bug in a heat tempest test, we failed to
raise a validation error if a domain_id was not specified in
a create call for a user, group or project. Instead, we tried
the default domain.  This is neither in the spec or what we
want.

Although we would like to remove this, in case any customers
have discovered this undocumented feature, for now we just
issue a deprecation warning, saying that we intend to remove
this is during the N release.

Closes-bug: #1482330
Change-Id: Ib3fe50c49063a64146709e57ddbec6665e64160b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/48/209848/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: msg = _('No domain information specified as part of create' ' request') raise exception.ValidationError(message=msg)
deleted_lines: # TODO(henry-nash): We should issue an exception here since if # a v3 call does not explicitly specify the domain_id in the # entity, it should be using a domain scoped token. However, # the current tempest heat tests issue a v3 call without this. # This is raised as bug #1283539. Once this is fixed, we # should remove the line below and replace it with an error. return CONF.identity.default_domain_id

commit_message:
Fix users/tenants in Neutron job and sample tasks

Nearly all of the tasks in the Neutron job and nearly all of the
Neutron sample tasks had silly numbers of users and tenants, either
far too many (e.g., 25 users for 10 times) or far too few (e.g., one
user for 100 times). This makes them more reasonable and consistent.

Change-Id: I9ab0e8580be490375a30172b3c8dc277de559961
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/59/218859/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tenants: 2 users_per_tenant: 3

commit_message:
Add SPARK_YARN_HISTORY_SERVER to default templates for cdh

Sahara EDP has been extended to support spark on cdh, so the
default templates should include the spark history server necessary
to run jobs on yarn.

Change-Id: I56fbbd97f52154f78fc5015055a44e20f63838b2
Implements: blueprint spark-jobs-for-cdh-5-3-0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/20/221420/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Try to get the version of cloud init via popen

Now we can fail while trying to get the version of cloud-init
via pkg_resources. Try to get the version via ordinary cmd call
'cloud-init --version'.

Change-Id: I39d4d52ba1ac83183a0a46c7f3a70a14b782562a
Closes-Bug: #1481614
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/44/209844/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import re try: v = version.LooseVersion( pkg_resources.get_distribution('cloud-init').version) return v >= version.LooseVersion('0.6.0') except Exception: pass data = subprocess.Popen(['cloud-init', '--version'], stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE).communicate() if data[0]: raise Exception() # data[1] has such format: 'cloud-init 0.7.5\n', need to parse version v = re.split(' |\n', data[1])[1] return tuple(v) >= tuple('0', '6', '0') try: if not chk_ci_version(): # pre 0.6.0 - user data executed via cloudinit, not this helper LOG.error('Unable to log provisioning, need a newer version of ' 'cloud-init') return -1 except Exception: LOG.warning("Can\'n determine the version of cloud-init. It is " "possible to get error while running provisioning.")
deleted_lines: v = version.LooseVersion( pkg_resources.get_distribution('cloud-init').version) return v >= version.LooseVersion('0.6.0') if not chk_ci_version(): # pre 0.6.0 - user data executed via cloudinit, not this helper LOG.error('Unable to log provisioning, need a newer version of ' 'cloud-init') return -1

commit_message:
Corrected "Network Address" CSS error in "Create Subnet" modal

When click the "next" button while "Network Address" is
blank in "Create Subnet" modal dialog, there will display
"This field is required.", but the string shows css error.
This patch correct the error.

Change-Id: I6bbb3228d17ad971489174532a2ed828bbd77669
Closes-Bug: #1481131

commit_message:
Refactor and correct purge_deleted

This method had not been updated in a while
to account for changes in the db schema. Also,
it was refactored to use bulk delete statements
rather than iteration as the iteration approach
ran quite a long time and consumed quite a bit
of resources.

Change-Id: Ia49e801d3c244a1fabb8441e7eaa22b88e5fcb56
Closes-Bug: #1439518
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/84/201384/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stack_lock = sqlalchemy.Table('stack_lock', meta, autoload=True) resource = sqlalchemy.Table('resource', meta, autoload=True) resource_data = sqlalchemy.Table('resource_data', meta, autoload=True) # find the soft-deleted stacks that are past their expiry stack_where = sqlalchemy.select([stack.c.id]).where( stack.c.deleted_at < time_line) # delete stack locks (just in case some got stuck) stack_lock_del = stack_lock.delete().where( stack_lock.c.stack_id.in_(stack_where)) engine.execute(stack_lock_del) # delete resource_data res_where = sqlalchemy.select([resource.c.id]).where( resource.c.stack_id.in_(stack_where)) res_data_del = resource_data.delete().where( resource_data.c.resource_id.in_(res_where)) engine.execute(res_data_del) # delete resources res_del = resource.delete().where(resource.c.stack_id.in_(stack_where)) engine.execute(res_del) # delete events event_del = event.delete().where(event.c.stack_id.in_(stack_where)) engine.execute(event_del) # delete the stacks stack_del = stack.delete().where(stack.c.deleted_at < time_line) engine.execute(stack_del) # delete orphaned raw templates stack_templ_sel = sqlalchemy.select([stack.c.raw_template_id]) raw_templ_sel = sqlalchemy.not_(raw_template.c.id.in_(stack_templ_sel)) raw_templ_del = raw_template.delete().where(raw_templ_sel) engine.execute(raw_templ_del) # purge any user creds that are no longer referenced stack_creds_sel = sqlalchemy.select([stack.c.user_creds_id]) user_creds_sel = sqlalchemy.not_(user_creds.c.id.in_(stack_creds_sel)) usr_creds_del = user_creds.delete().where(user_creds_sel) engine.execute(usr_creds_del) # Purge deleted services srvc_del = service.delete().where(service.c.deleted_at < time_line) engine.execute(srvc_del)
deleted_lines: # Purge deleted stacks stmt = sqlalchemy.select( [stack.c.id, stack.c.raw_template_id, stack.c.user_creds_id] ).where(stack.c.deleted_at < time_line) deleted_stacks = engine.execute(stmt) for s in deleted_stacks: event_del = event.delete().where(event.c.stack_id == s[0]) engine.execute(event_del) stack_del = stack.delete().where(stack.c.id == s[0]) engine.execute(stack_del) raw_template_del = raw_template.delete().where( raw_template.c.id == s[1]) engine.execute(raw_template_del) user_creds_del = user_creds.delete().where(user_creds.c.id == s[2]) engine.execute(user_creds_del) # Purge deleted services stmt = (sqlalchemy.select([service.c.id]). where(service.c.deleted_at < time_line)) deleted_services = engine.execute(stmt) for s in deleted_services: stmt = service.delete().where(service.c.id == s[0]) engine.execute(stmt)

commit_message:
Make sure UpdatePolicy is unset for Heat scaling group

It is defined within the properties as rolling_updates.
This patch is to make it more obvious to users that UpdatePolicy
is not supported.

Change-Id: I8162d27036843d0b9282cd8f4aa4d2eb93afba19
Closes-bug: 1423426

commit_message:
Set the flavor to large for the cdh 5.4.0 name node in template.conf

The sample template.conf file for default templates should show the
flavor being set to large for the cdh 5.4.0 name node.

Change-Id: Ie5105776fe52d16cc640199c182f3285b89234a3
Closes-bug: #1493527

commit_message:
install keystoneauth1 on rpm based systems

Temporary workaroung to fix a keystoneauth1 packaging issue [1].
Install keystoneauth1 with pip until the package is fixed, so we can
unblock our CI.

[1] https://www.redhat.com/archives/rdo-list/2015-September/msg00155.html

Change-Id: I9681f129181b5a7fc0b04f8490a989e24c75d81a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/53/224953/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # keystoneauth1 package seems broken in RDO # https://www.redhat.com/archives/rdo-list/2015-September/msg00155.html # temporary workaround: /usr/bin/pip install keystoneauth1

'connect_vnic_to_vswitch' already exists in networkutils.
